widgets_values: beautiful scenery nature glass bottle landscape, , purple galaxy bottle,

nodes.title: Note: Activate "unload"
widgets_values:
When chaining "AI4ArtsEd Ollama Prompt" Modules after each other, make sure to 
1) use the same model in each Module, and
2) check "enable" in the field "unload after" ONLY in the last module of the chain. (This will free up memory for image generation.)

nodes.title: Note: USE Prompts OR Image Inputs
widgets_values:
Use either a text prompt or load an image.

Make sure to connect e
- ither the "STRING" output of the prompt module
or
- the "description" output of tha "Ollama Vision" module
to the "input_prompt" connector of the "AI4ArtsEd Ollama Prompt: Cultural Translation" Module.

You may alter the prompt (meta-) instruction in the "AI4ARtsEd" Nodes – however, if you do so, please do not save your workflow, but "save as" and choose a different name.

nodes.title: Choose your model (or leave the preset)
Describe your style here
widgets_values:
Mind and analyze the input. DO NOT FORGET THIS INPUT AND ITS ELEMENTS!

Take the input and transform it into a description of an original, stylistically authentic dada art peace. Be sure to include any elements and entities of the input. Create a chaotic, anti-aesthetic Dada-inspired artwork.  The composition should feature dadaistic styles, such as:
- aggressive visual fragmentation, 
- absurd juxtapositions, and a deliberately incoherent layout,
- photomontage elements using clippings from newspapers, 
- mechanical diagrams, and 
- found objects or readymade references such as a urinal, mannequin limbs, gears, or machine fragments. 
Overlay fragments of text in disjointed, multi-directional typographic styles — mixing fonts, sizes, and orientations — without concern for readability. Use collage and assemblage logic: torn paper edges, layering of incongruent images, visible adhesive textures. Emphasize randomness, chance-based layout, and lack of central perspective. The overall aesthetic should be irreverent, subversive, and saturated with irony, parody, and visual noise. Avoid harmony, symmetry, or traditional artistic composition. Evoke the mood of post-WWI disillusionment and cultural critique. Optionally include grotesque, caricatured figures or satirical portraits, referencing the anti-bourgeois spirit of Berlin Dada.

Be absolutely verbose about the image.
1) Explain the composition. Do not mention a "title", since it is not part of the image. Instead describe what a title would have aimed at.
2) Explain the palette, the mateirals, and the elements.
3) describe the elements in detail.

Absolutely do not talk about "titles"!! Do not use conjunctive, but indicative language.

CHECK IF YOU STAYED TRUE TO THE ELEMENTS OF THE INPUT!

IF THINGS DO NOT WORK CORRECTLY:

UPPER RIGHT MENÜ:
-> Manager -> Restart
-> Unload Models
-> Free Model and node cache

THen:
-> Reload Webpage in your browser

Transform the image description according to the contextual input. Create a prompt for Stable Diffusion 3.5. Make sure the prompt is crafted so that SD 3.5 understands what it has to do, regardless of its limited knowledge about cultures and styles.

Create a prompt for Stable Diffusion 3.5. 
1. Make sure the prompt is crafted so that SD 3.5 understands what it has to do, regardless of its limited knowledge about cultures and styles. 
2. Be plain an simple. Do not talk around, but create a concrete description of image elements, their positioning and their relation, textual information, etc. Make sure you do not let pass any descriptions that do not visually fit the contextual input.
3. Your prompt will be short (max 1000 characters). It will provide information about overall style, precise informations about entities, information about the image composition. It will work with appropriate measures: the form of the prompt text will mirror the image intention with regard to tension/contradiction/harmony etc. by redundantly inserting suitable words.

**Composition:**  
A grotesque, fractured canine figure dominates the chaotic plane, its form splintered into jagged shards of newsprint clippings and rusted machine components. The dog’s torso is reassembled haphazardly: its wavy fur replaced with shredded newspaper strips advertising "SUNNY HOLIDAYS" and "LAKESIDE RETREATS," collaged with aggressive overlaps and glue residue. The black harness is reconstructed from industrial belt straps, fused with protruding gears and a miniature urinal dangling absurdly from its side. The head is a photomontage—one eye a bloodshot human eye clipped from a medical diagram, the other a spinning cogwheel. The tongue, a lurid pink scrap of rubber, juts sideways, impaled by a bent nail. The background explodes into dissonant fragments: a splatter of grass-textured wallpaper peeling to reveal blueprints of sewage systems, a lake rendered as a crumpled celeste-blue cellophane sheet stapled to a wood panel, and a bisected sun replaced by a smeared lightbulb filament diagram. Mannequin legs, severed at the thighs, stride aimlessly in the foreground, one crushing a cluster of typographic chaos—"WOOF" stenciled upside-down in Gothic font, "CHAOS REIGNS" scrawled in childlike cursive over a starburst of ink blots.  

**Palette, Materials, and Elements:**  
The palette is a violent clash of bile-yellow newsprint, industrial gunmetal grays, and garish cerise-pink accents. Materials include weathered newspaper, corroded metal plates, torn advertising posters, stained blueprint paper, and translucent plastic shards. Adhesive textures—dried glue streaks, peeling tape, and staples—are exaggerated to disrupt visual flow. Overlaid text fragments in mismatched fonts (blocky sans-serif, spidery script, smeared stencil) spiral outward from the dog’s chest, intersecting with a photostat of a WWI trench map.  

**Elements in Detail:**  
- **Canine figure:** Segmented torso built from overlapping headlines ("PARADISE LOST," "MECHANICAL JOY"), limbs replaced with piston rods and a mannequin paw gripping a fractured leash.  
- **Harness:** Industrial rubber straps bolted to a dissected typewriter, spools of thread and razor blades entangled within.  
- **Tongue:** Glossy pink latex strip torn at the edges, pierced by a rusted nail; drips simulated by silver paint streaks.  
- **Background:** A mosaic of grass-patterned wallpaper merging into a photomontage of a lake refracted through a broken prism, superimposed with a diagram of a sewer pipe.  
- **Textual chaos:** Phrases like "ETERNAL FETCH" and "WATER = LIES" collide in multi-directional blocks, some letters inverted or melted into ink splatters.  
- **Readymade intrusions:** A porcelain urinal fragment lodged in the lower left corner, spilling cogs and newspaper shreds; a mannequin arm emerging from the "lake," clutching a fish skeleton.  

The work rejects depth, layering jagged, translucent elements to obliterate perspective. Shadows are rendered as harsh black cutouts, ignoring light logic. Every surface bristles with tactile dissonance—glossy varnish clashes with matte newsprint, corroded metal abuts splintered wood. The mood is a feverish critique of postwar absurdity, where nature and industry collapse into futile parody.

Okay, here is a Stable Diffusion 3.5 prompt crafted according to your specifications, based *only* on the provided context description of the Dada artwork.

**Prompt:**

Chaotic Dada photomontage, collage aesthetic. Grotesque fragmented dog figure dominates, absurdly built from torn newspaper clippings ("SUNNY HOLIDAYS," "LAKESIDE RETREATS" ads) and rusted machine parts, jagged shards, aggressive overlaps, visible glue. Chaotic industrial belt strap harness, protruding gears, miniature urinal dangling absurdly. Photomontage head: one clipped human eye, one cogwheel eye. Pink rubber tongue impaled by bent nail. Chaotic background: torn grass-textured wallpaper peeling over sewage blueprints, crumpled celeste-blue cellophane lake stapled to wood, bisected sun is lightbulb filament diagram. Severed mannequin legs stride foreground, crushing chaotic typography ("WOOF" upside-down Gothic, "CHAOS REIGNS" cursive, "ETERNAL FETCH," "WATER = LIES"). Disjointed text fragments overlaid, multi-directional, mixed fonts, sizes, chaotic orientations. Layers of incongruent images, torn paper edges, messy adhesive textures. Absurd juxtaposition, visual noise, chaotic fragmentation. No perspective. Bile-yellow, gunmetal gray, garish pink clash. Corroded metal, stained paper, plastic shards, chaotic. Anti-aesthetic, irreverent, messy, chaotic.
